trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection"></xref> class is an abstract class and cannot be instantiated.

Use the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> or <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> classes to connect to a directory server.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.#ctor"></xref> constructor initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates"></xref> property specifies one or more client certificates to send for authentication.
One or more client certificates to send for authentication.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.Credential"></xref> property specifies alternate credentials for the connection object.
If not specified, the default value is `null`.
Alternate credentials for the connection object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.Directory"></xref> property specifies the domain or the server to which the connection should be made.
For example, "http://fabrikam.com/platforms/adssoap.dll" represents a DSML server and "dc-01.fabrikam.com" represents an LDAP server.
The domain or the server to which the connection should be made.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.SendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest)"></xref> method sends a single directory operation to the server.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object that contains the request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the server response to the request operation.
The returned response object may be different than the requested object if the server returns a different response.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.Timeout"></xref> property contains the length of time, in seconds, before the connection times out.
Thirty seconds is the default time length property setting.
The length of time, in seconds, before the connection times out.
